buildup.text: Recruited in the 1930s by Soviet handlers, they believed communism would save the world from fascism.

discovery.text: Kim Philby rose to lead MI6's anti-Soviet section. He was literally hunting himself.

twist.text: When two members defected to Moscow in 1951, Philby helped them escapeâ€”then stayed undercover for 12 more years.

climax.text: The betrayal shattered trust between British and American intelligence for a generation.

punchline.text: Britain's top spy catcher was the top spy.

quiz.question: What was ironic about Kim Philby's position in MI6?
options: He headed the section responsible for catching Soviet spies
He was assigned to recruit double agents in Moscow
He trained new agents who later uncovered him
